images.caption: Figure 1:Comparison between the direct rollout (blue) and hinted rollout (purple). The hint consists of the first few steps from an annotated solution. Adding a hint can simplify the problem and guide the LLM toward completing correct solutions.

Figure 2:Overview of SEELE. In each step, SEELE conductsmmrollout rounds.
In roundii, an adaptive hinty1:l(i)y_{1:l^{(i)}}is appended to the original problem,
wherey1:l(i)y_{1:l^{(i)}}is a prefix of the full solutionyywith lengthl(i)l^{(i)},
determined by the accuracy-hint modelfϕf_{\phi}to achieve the target rollout accuracya∗a^{*}.
The output accuracies within each round are then used to updatefϕf_{\phi}, enabling more accurate predictions in subsequent rounds.
Finally, SEELE computes the advantage function over the outputs of allmmrounds, which is used to update the policy model.
Figure 3:Cases of the accuracy-hint curves and the 3PL fitted curve and parameters. We select 4 typical curves to demonstrate the expressive power of 3PL model.
Figure 4:Training dynamics of RL compared with baselines.Left: training rewards;Middle: Response length;Right: averaged accuracy on math reasoning validation sets.
Figure 5:Accuracy within each rollout round during training. The red dotted line denotes the targeted accuracy.Left: Qwen2.5-1.5B;Right: Qwen2.5-3B.
Figure 6:Performance for different target accuracya∗a^{*}using Qwen2.5-1.5B.
